root.info: Mining preferences for algorithms in the Clired/Siren redescription mining tools. A default preferences file can be obtained by calling the main mining routine exec_clired.py --config and a basic configuration template with exec_clired.py --template.

parameter.name: mining_algo
parameter.label: Mining algorithm
parameter.legend: CORE Algorithm to use for mining, greedy ReReMi or based on classification trees (restrictions apply).

parameter.name: max_var_s0
parameter.label: LHS max number of variables
parameter.legend: Maximum number of variables in a left-hand side query, maximum tree depth in tree-based algorithms.

parameter.name: max_var_s1
parameter.label: RHS max number of variables
parameter.legend: Maximum number of variables in a right-hand side query, maximum tree depth in tree-based algorithms.

parameter.name: min_itm_c
parameter.label: Min contribution
parameter.legend: Minimum contribution, number of supporting entities impacted by the addition of a literal in ReReMi or minimum node size in tree-based algorithms. Values between 0 and 1 are interpreted as ratio of the total number of entities.

parameter.name: min_itm_in
parameter.label: Min support
parameter.legend: CORE Minimum number of supporting entities. Values between 0 and 1 are interpreted as ratio of the total number of entities.

parameter.name: min_itm_out
parameter.label: Min uncovered
parameter.legend: CORE Minimum number of uncovered entities. Values between 0 and 1 are interpreted as ratio of the total number of entities.

parameter.name: min_impr
parameter.label: Min improvement
parameter.legend: Minimum improvement score for an acceptable extension.

parameter.name: max_inits
parameter.label: Max initial candidates
parameter.legend: Maximum number of initial candidates explored, pairs for ReReMi, initial targets for trees. -1 leads to expand all.

parameter.name: inits_productivity
parameter.label: Initial candidates productivity
parameter.legend: Productivity when creating an initial pair of literals from non-Boolean variables.

parameter.name: min_fin_in
parameter.label: Min support
parameter.legend: Minimum number of supporting entities, applied for final filtering. Values between 0 and 1 are interpreted as ratio of the total number of entities.

parameter.name: min_fin_out
parameter.label: Min uncovered
parameter.legend: Minimum number of uncovered entities, applied for final filtering. Values between 0 and 1 are interpreted as ratio of the total number of entities.

parameter.name: min_fin_acc
parameter.label: Min accuracy
parameter.legend: Minimum accuracy, applied for final filtering.

parameter.name: max_fin_pval
parameter.label: Max p-value
parameter.legend: Maximum p-value, applied for final filtering.

parameter.name: max_overlap_area
parameter.label: Max Area Overlap
parameter.legend: Two redescriptions whose area overlap is beyond this ratio are considered redundant.

parameter.name: max_overlap_rows
parameter.label: Max Rows Overlap
parameter.legend: Two redescriptions whose row overlap is beyond this ratio are considered redundant.

parameter.name: nb_processes
parameter.label: Nb processes
parameter.legend: Maximum number of mining processes to use in parallel.

parameter.name: verbosity
parameter.label: Log verbosity
parameter.legend: Verbosity of the mining process output.

parameter.name: batch_out
parameter.label: Batch output
parameter.legend: Maximum number of redescriptions returned from an expansion batch.

parameter.name: min_fin_var
parameter.label: Min total number of variables
parameter.legend: Maximum number of variables per redescription, applied for final filtering.

parameter.name: in_weight
parameter.label: Weight Inside
parameter.legend: Weight for entities inside selected area (only applies when such an area is specified).

parameter.name: out_weight
parameter.label: Weight Outside
parameter.legend: Weight for entities outside selected area (only applies when such an area is specified).

parameter.name: var_compat
parameter.label: Var group compatibility
parameter.legend: Fixes whether group ids should differ or match for variables to be considered compatible (gid=-1 is universally compatible).

parameter.name: method_pval
parameter.label: p-value formula
parameter.legend: Formula used for computing the p-value.

parameter.name: parts_type
parameter.label: Missing values belief
parameter.legend: How to consider missing values when computing support statistics.

parameter.name: max_rounds
parameter.label: Max rounds in CartWheel
parameter.legend: Maximum number of alternations in CartWheel algorithm.

parameter.name: split_criterion
parameter.label: Split criterion
parameter.legend: Score used to evaluate splits during decision tree induction.

parameter.name: splittrees_init_depth
parameter.label: Init depth
parameter.legend: Maximum tree depth for the split in the first round.

parameter.name: splittrees_update_target
parameter.label: Update target
parameter.legend: Update the target between tree growing rounds.

parameter.name: splittrees_both_sides_change
parameter.label: Both sides change
parameter.legend: Require both sides to be different in successive tree growing rounds.

parameter.name: splittrees_dyn_side
parameter.label: Dynamic side
parameter.legend: Choose the side on which to grow the tree first depending on the source of the target (else always start with RHS).

parameter.name: neg_query_s0_1
parameter.label: LHS Literals Bool
parameter.legend: Types of literals allowed in the left-hand side queries for Boolean literals.

parameter.name: neg_query_s0_2
parameter.label: LHS Literals Cat
parameter.legend: Types of literals allowed in the left-hand side queries for categorical literals.

parameter.name: neg_query_s0_3
parameter.label: LHS Literals Num
parameter.legend: Types of literals allowed in the left-hand side queries for numerical literals.

parameter.name: ops_query_s0
parameter.label: LHS Operators
parameter.legend: Type of operators allowed in the left-hand side queries.

parameter.name: neg_query_s1_1
parameter.label: RHS Literals Bool
parameter.legend: Types of literals allowed in the right-hand side queries for Boolean literals.

parameter.name: neg_query_s1_2
parameter.label: RHS Literals Cat
parameter.legend: Types of literals allowed in the right-hand side queries for categorical literals.

parameter.name: neg_query_s1_3
parameter.label: RHS Literals Num
parameter.legend: Types of literals allowed in the right-hand side queries for numerical literals.

parameter.name: ops_query_s1
parameter.label: RHS Operators
parameter.legend: Type of operators allowed in the right-hand side queries.

parameter.name: single_side_or
parameter.label: Single side OR
parameter.legend: Restrict use of disjunction to only one side.

parameter.name: multi_cats
parameter.label: Multi categories
parameter.legend: Allow combining multiple categories of a categorical variable.

parameter.name: add_condition
parameter.label: Conditional
parameter.legend: Allow making conditional redescriptions, if suitable data is provided.

parameter.name: pair_sel
parameter.label: Expansion order
parameter.legend: Order in which the initial pairs are processed, either overall next best score or alternating between side considering next best variables in turn.

parameter.name: min_pairscore
parameter.label: Min score
parameter.legend: Minimum score for an initial pair to be considered.

parameter.name: pe_balance
parameter.label: Pairs-expand balance
parameter.legend: Balance between generating initial pairs and expanding them (0 means generating all pairs first).

parameter.name: score.impacc
parameter.label: Accuracy improvement coefficient
parameter.legend: Coefficient of the accuracy improvement for scoring extension candidates.

parameter.name: score.rel_impacc
parameter.label: Relative Accurracy improvement coefficient
parameter.legend: Coefficient of the relative accuracy improvement for scoring extension candidates.

parameter.name: score.pval_red
parameter.label: Redescription p-value coefficient
parameter.legend: Coefficient of the redescription p-value for scoring extension candidates. Negative values are interpreted as a threshold weighted by p-value factor.

parameter.name: score.pval_query
parameter.label: Query p-value coefficient
parameter.legend: Coefficient of the query p-value for scoring extension candidates. Negative values are interpreted as a threshold weighted by p-value factor.

parameter.name: score.pval_fact
parameter.label: p-value factor
parameter.legend: Weight for p-value in case of using thresholds for scoring extension candidates.

parameter.name: batch_cap
parameter.label: Batch capacity
parameter.legend: Maximum number of candidates expanded at each step of the search.

parameter.name: amnesic
parameter.label: Amnesic
parameter.legend: Not amnesic means the algorithm remembers previously generated redescriptions and avoid generating them again.

parameter.name: max_seg
parameter.label: Max number segments
parameter.legend: Maximum number of segments, i.e. distinct values for a numerical variable.

parameter.name: lower_tail_agg
parameter.label: Lower tail aggregate
parameter.legend: Threshold for the lower tail, when aggregating keeping only extreme values.

parameter.name: upper_tail_agg
parameter.label: Upper tail aggregate
parameter.legend: Threshold for the upper tail, when aggregating keeping only extreme values.

parameter.name: max_agg
parameter.label: Max aggregation
parameter.legend: Maximum number of buckets aggregated together.

parameter.name: max_prodbuckets
parameter.label: Max product buckets
parameter.legend: Maximum product of the number of buckets on either side.
